Constructor Detail

Main

public Main()
Method Detail

execute

public void execute(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> commandlist)
Controll and manage the Test Server methods and conditions.

Parameters:
commandlist - LinkedList containing the necessary parameters to execute the Test Server (this parameter should contain the path to the config.xml file).

setWebServerFolders

public void setWebServerFolders()
This method gets the WEBSERVER_ADDRESS parameter from ConfigXML and, sets the FTP address and the WEBSERVER address in locals variables.

setQTPFolders

public void setQTPFolders()
This method gets the QTP files locations and, sets the local variables containing the correct path to the file in the machine where the files are found (i.e. \\QTP Server IP\drive$\qtpLogFile)

verifyEnvVars

public void verifyEnvVars(int check)
Perform the Environment Variables tests.

Parameters:
check - Integer parameter determining what test needs to be executed.
'0' (zero) to verify the environment variable after install;
'1' (one) to verify the environment variable after uninstall;

QTPResultsLogger

public void QTPResultsLogger()
Method responsible to copy the QTP files for the Test Server machine, read the file content and write in the HTML log file.

WebServerHome

public void WebServerHome()
Method responsible to call the WebServerHome method that Reads and writes again the index.html file with the updated information.

copyFile

public void copyFile()
Method responsible to copy the FTP server files and the WEBSERVER files to the Machine with the WebServer installed.

executeQTPTests

public void executeQTPTests()
Method responsible to start the QTP tests execution

getLatestBuild

public boolean getLatestBuild()
Method responsible to start the latest build identification.

Returns:
true if the build was identified correctly and, false if not.

getSpecificBuild

public boolean getSpecificBuild(java.lang.String build)
Method responsible to start the build identification.

Parameters:
build - build number to be identified.
Returns:
true if the build was identified correctly and, false if not.

download

public boolean download()
Method responsible to start the download of the build identified.

Returns:
true if the download was executed correctly and, false if not.

Install

public boolean Install()
Perform the VCEM installation with as following parameters: 
 setup.exe /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES
 /XMLINPUT=< VCEMXML Input file location >
 /DIR=< location where the VCEM should be installed >
 /LOGFILE= < log file location > 
 /DBPWD=< password >  
 /INSTALLTYPE=< standalone|plugin >

Returns:
true if the installation was executed correctly and, false if not.

Uninstall

public void Uninstall()
Perform the VCEM installation with as following parameters: 
  unins000.exe
  /VERYSILENT
  /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES
  /LOG= < log file location >

verifyDeployedFiles

public void verifyDeployedFiles()
Perform the Deployed Files test.

verifyRemovedFiles

public void verifyRemovedFiles()
Perform the Removed Files test.

readVCEMOutput

public void readVCEMOutput()
Perform the VcemOutput XML test.

verifyInstallLog

public void verifyInstallLog()
Perform the Installation Log test.

verifyUninstallLog

public void verifyUninstallLog()
Perform the Uninstallation Log test.

verifyInstallRegistry

public void verifyInstallRegistry()
Perform the installation registry key test.

verifyUninstallRegistry

public void verifyUninstallRegistry()
Perform the uninstallation registry key test.

logWriter

public void logWriter(java.lang.String str)
Method responsible to write messages in the log file.

Parameters:
str - String containing a message to be written in the Test Server '.log' file.

HTMLLogWriter

public void HTMLLogWriter(java.lang.String test,
                          java.lang.String additionalInfo,
                          java.lang.String result)
Method responsible to write messages in the HTML log file.

Parameters:
test - - test description.
additionalInfo - - test details (result details, comments, etc...)
result - - test result (warn, pass, unknown, not executed, done and fail), If this parameter is not informed the method searches for key words, to determine the result.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Start the Test Server execution by calling the method main.execute(commandList). The commandList should contain the following information:
/XMLINPUT= < path to the Test Server config.xml file >

Parameters:
args - String containing the following parameter: /XMLINPUT= < path to the Test Server config.xml file >
